senses.de: To combine or blend things together.
senses.ex: Mix the flour and sugar together before adding eggs.

Tips.title: Non-literal Use
Tips.description: Sometimes 'mix' means combining abstract things, like ideas.
Tips.example: The artist mixes traditional and modern techniques.

Tips.title: Metaphorical Mixing
Tips.description: 'Mix' can be used metaphorically to describe situations.
Tips.example: His statement was a mix of truth and lies.

senses.de: A combination or blend of different things.
senses.ex: The music album is a mix of rock, jazz and blues.

Tips.title: Diversity Emphasis
Tips.description: Using 'mix' can emphasize diversity or variety in a group.
Tips.example: The team is a good mix of experienced and novice players.

Tips.title: Cultural Uses
Tips.description: The word 'mix' can be used to discuss cultural phenomena.
Tips.example: The city's vibrant mix of cultures is celebrated annually.

senses.de: To socialize or associate with other people.
senses.ex: It's important to mix with people from different cultures.

Tips.title: Social Agility
Tips.description: Being able to 'mix' implies adaptability in social settings.
Tips.example: She can mix well at both casual and formal gatherings.

Tips.title: Networking
Tips.description: 'Mix' can refer to the act of networking for professional reasons.
Tips.example: The conference is a great place to mix with industry leaders.

senses.ex: You need to mix the dough until it's smooth.

Tips.title: Cooking Precision
Tips.description: In cooking, 'mix' often requires following specific instructions.
Tips.example: Mix the ingredients gently to avoid deflating the batter.

Tips.title: Result Importance
Tips.description: How you 'mix' can affect the taste and texture of food.
Tips.example: For a smoother soup, mix the ingredients thoroughly.

senses.de: A product made of different substances mixed together.
senses.ex: The concrete mix has sand, cement and water.

Tips.title: Technical Contexts
Tips.description: In technical fields, 'mix' can imply preparing a substance.
Tips.example: Ensure the mix is consistent before applying it.

Tips.title: Industry Vocabulary
Tips.description: Some industries have specific 'mixes' for products or materials.
Tips.example: This concrete mix is specially formulated for high durability.

Blend.wordDefinition:
The words blend and mix are pretty similar, but there are some differences between them.

When you blend something, you are combining different ingredients together until they become smooth and well-integrated.

You might use a blender or food processor to help you blend ingredients, such as when making a smoothie.

You might use blend when you want to create a uniform texture or consistency, such as when making a sauce or soup. You might use mix when you just want to combine ingredients together, such as when making a batter or dough.

Combine.wordDefinition:
Combine generally means to bring two or more things together to make a single item. For example, if you combine flour, sugar, eggs, and butter, you can make a cake.

Mix generally means to combine two or more things together without necessarily making a new single item. For example, if you mix water and food coloring, you get tinted water - the water and the food coloring don't become a new substance.

So, in short, combine implies a specific recipe, while mix implies more freedom in the process.

Commingle.wordDefinition:
Commingle and mix both mean to combine two or more things together, but there is a subtle difference between the two.

Commingle implies that the things being combined are of different types or origins, and that they're being mixed together in a way that's difficult to separate.

For example, you might commingle funds from different accounts or mix different colors of paint to create a new shade. Commingle would be more applicable in financial or legal contexts, while mix would be more applicable in cooking or art contexts.

Fuse.wordDefinition:
Fuse means to join or blend two or more things together by melting or heating them. It is applicable when we talk about joining two or more substances together, such as fusing metal pieces together in welding or fusing two plastic pieces using heat.

Fuse is used when things are being joined together by heating, and mix is used when things are combined together without changing their properties.

Intermingle.wordDefinition:
The words intermingle and mix both mean to combine two or more things together.

However, intermingle suggests a more complex and intricate mixing, where the components are closely intertwined and difficult to separate.

Intermingle is used when referring to things that are heavily intertwined, such as the fibers of a fabric, while mix is used more generally to describe combining any sort of ingredients or components.

Interweave.wordDefinition:
Interweave means to combine or blend things together, much like how threads are woven together to make a fabric.

To summarize, interweave is more deliberate and implies a more intricate blending, while mix is a broader term used for simple combining.

Merge.wordDefinition:
The words merge and mix both refer to combining things, but they are used in slightly different situations.

Merge usually means combining two or more things - like companies, teams, or organizations - into one, larger entity.

It often implies a more formal or official process of joining together. For example, two companies might merge to become a single, larger company.

So, in summary: merge is used when we are talking about two or more things becoming one larger thing, and mix is used when we are talking about things coming together to create a blend or combination of some kind.

Mingle.wordDefinition:
Mingle means to move around and talk with different people or groups of people at a social gathering, while the word mix means to combine different substances or objects together.

For example, at a party, you might mingle with different guests, moving from group to group and chatting with different people.

Mingle is applicable in social situations where you are interacting with other people, while mix is applicable in situations where you are combining different elements to create something new.

quotes.Text: You've got to support male stories and healthy male relationships and things. You can't just be a woman that is only want to support female stories or a guy that's only wanting to support guy stories. It needs to all mix again.
quotes.Title: English Actress
quotes.Name: Jessica Barden

quotes.Text: In terms of work, obviously acting is such a job that is very in the flesh kind of thing. It's your work, but it's your life, in a way. You can get so mixed up.

quotes.Name: Gael Garcia Bernal

quotes.Text: I take in a lot of stuff from real life, movies, television, news and it all gets mixed in my head and somehow turns into a story idea.

quotes.Name: Janet Evanovich

quotes.Text: No period of my life has been one of such unmixed happiness as the four years which have been spent within college walls.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Horatio Alger

quotes.Text: I think it's important to not always wear pants and not always wear dresses. You should and mix that up.

quotes.Text: It's important to have the right mix of experience and youth.

quotes.Name: Ravi Shastri

quotes.Text: My personality is I enjoy constant change and mixing it up.

quotes.Text: No advantages in this world are pure and unmixed.

quotes.Text: Life mixes tones all the time.
